newsitem.title: INDIA: India's Chidambaram expects to meet fiscal goal.
newsitem.headline: India's Chidambaram expects to meet fiscal goal.

text.p: Indian Finance Minister Palaniappan Chidambaram said on Wednesday that he was confident the government would meet its goal of reducing the 1996/97 (April-March) fiscal deficit as a share of gross domestic product (GDP) to 5.0 percent from 5.9 percent in 1995/96.
"I am confident we will keep the fiscal deficit down to five percent," Chidambaram told reporters.
"We have done reasonably well so far," he said, noting that the government's spending over the past four months was more or less on target.

Chidambaram said there was some justification for scepticism that the government might fail to reach the fiscal deficit target as the deficit had often exceeded government estimates. But he said he was being tight-fisted on spending.
